intro: Hirpicium linearifolium, commonly known as the slender-leaved hirpicium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves that are often arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of Europe and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Hirpicium linearifolium is generally herbaceous and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
